tit.e: Meisho Edo Hyakkei (One Hundred Famous Views of Edo)
Meisho Edo Hyakkei (100 Famous Views of Edo)
Meisho Edo Hyakkei (100 Famous Views of Edo)

sen.j: 名所江戸百景（めいしょえどひゃっけい）とは、浮世絵師の歌川広重が安政3年（1856年）から同5年（1858年）にかけて制作した連作浮世絵である。
sen.e: Meisho Edo Hyakkei is a series of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) created between 1856 to 1858 by Hiroshige UTAGAWA, an ukiyoe artist.
Meisho Edo Hyakkei is a series of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) created by Hiroshige UTAGAWA, an ukiyoe artist, from 1856 to 1858.
Meisho Edo Hyakkei is a series of ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints) created by Hiroshige UTAGAWA, an ukiyoe artist, from 1856 to 1858.

sen.j: 広重最晩年の作品であり、その死の直前まで制作が続けられた。
sen.e: It is a work from Hiroshige's latest years, and he continued to create his prints until the very last moment of his death.
It is a work from Hiroshige's latest years, and he continued to create his prints until the very last moment of his death.
It is a work from Hiroshige's latest years, and he continued to create his prints until the very last moment of his death.

sen.j: 最終的には完成しなかった。
sen.e: In the end, it was not completed.
In the end, it was not completed.
In the end, it was not completed.

sen.j: 二代目広重の補筆が加わって、「一立斎広重 一世一代 江戸百景」として刊行された。
sen.e: It was published as 'Ichiryusai Hiroshige Issei Ichidai Edo Hyakkei' (One Hundred Scenes of Edo, Hiroshige ICHIRYUSAI's work of a lifetime) after Hiroshige II added his contribution to the prints.
sen.cmt: 一立斎広重 一世一代 江戸百景 定訳不明
sen.e: It was published as 'Ichiryusai Hiroshige Issei Ichidai Edo Hyakkei' (100 Scenes of Edo, Hiroshige ICHIRYUSAI's work of a lifetime) after the second Hiroshige added his contribution to the prints.
It was published as 'Ichiryusai Hiroshige Issei Ichidai Edo Hyakkei' (100 Scenes of Edo, Hiroshige ICHIRYUSAI's work of a lifetime) after the second Hiroshige added his contribution to the prints.
The hanmoto (publisher) was Eikichi UOYA.
The hanmoto (publisher) was Eikichi UOYA.
The hanmoto (publisher) was Eikichi UOYA.

sen.j: 江戸末期の名所図絵の集大成ともいえる内容で、目録と118枚の図絵から成る。
sen.e: It can be said that it is a compilation of illustrations of famous views from the end of the Edo period, and it consists of 118 pages of illustrations and an index.
It can be said that it is a compilation of illustrations of famous views from the end of the Edo period, and it consists of 118 sheets of illustrations and an index.
It can be said that it is a compilation of illustrations of famous views from the end of the Edo period, and it consists of 118 sheets of illustrations and an index.

sen.j: 何気ない江戸の風景である。
sen.e: The prints are casual views of Edo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The illustrations are casual views of Edo.
The illustrations are casual views of Edo.

sen.j: しかし、近景と遠景の極端な切り取り方や、俯瞰、鳥瞰などを駆使した視点、またズームアップを多岐にわたって取り入れるなど斬新な構図が多い。
sen.e: However, there are many innovative compositions that use a wide range of perspectives, such as exaggerated ways of placing close-range and distant views, crow's nest view and bird's eye view, and close-ups views.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, there are many innovative compositions that use a wide range of perspectives, such as exaggerated ways of placing close-range and distant views, crow's nest view and bird's eye view, and close-ups views.

However, there are many innovative compositions that use a wide range of perspectives, such as exaggerated ways of placing close-range and distant views, crow's nest view and bird's eye view, and close-ups views.

sen.j: 視覚的な面白さもさることながら、多版刷りの技術も工夫を重ねて風景浮世絵としての完成度は随一ともいわれている。
sen.e: Not only is it visually interesting, it also makes use of creative method of multiple printing, and it is said that as ukiyoe of sceneries the degree of perfection is unmatched.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Not only is it visually interesting, it also makes use of creative method of multiple printing, and it is said that as ukiyoe of sceneries the degree of perfection is unmatched.
Not only is it visually interesting, it also makes use of creative method of multiple printing, and it is said that as ukiyoe of sceneries the degree of perfection is unmatched.

sen.j: 実際に「大はしあたけの夕立」や「亀戸梅屋舗」を模写したフィンセント・ファン・ゴッホをはじめ、日本的な「ジャポニズム」の代表作として西洋の画家に多大な影響を与えたシリーズでもある。
sen.e: As a practical matter, as a representative work of very Japanese 'Japonism,' it is a series that cast a large influence on western painters such as Vincent van Gogh, who replicated "Great Bridge, Sudden Shower at Atake" and "The Plum Orchard at Kameido."

As a practical matter, as a representative work of very Japanese 'Japonism,' it is a series that cast a large influence on western painters such as Vincent van Gogh, who replicated 'Great Bridge, Sudden Shower at Atake' and 'The Plum Orchard at Kameido.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。
sen.e: As a practical matter, as a representative work of very Japanese 'Japonism,' it is a series that cast a large influence on western painters such as Vincent van Gogh, who replicated 'Great Bridge, Sudden Shower at Atake' and 'The Plum Orchard at Kameido.'

sen.j: 名所図絵類の画題には複数の地名を羅列しただけのものが多い。
sen.e: Most of the titles for the illustrations of famous views are only listings of multiple place names.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Most of the titles for the illustrations of famous views are only listings of multiple place names.
Most of the titles for the illustrations of famous views are only listings of multiple place names.

sen.j: これらは適宜、「の」「より」「と」「を望む」などを補って読むとよい。
sen.e: It can be read by making appropriate additions such as 'no' (of), 'yori' (from), 'to' (and) and 'wo nozomu' (upon viewing of).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can be read by making appropriate additions such as 'no' (of), 'yori' (from), 'to' (and) and 'wo nozomu' (upon viewing of).
It can be read by making appropriate additions such as 'no' (of), 'yori' (from), 'to' (and) and 'wo nozomu' (upon viewing of).
Examples are given below.
Examples are given as follows.
Examples are given as follows.

sen.j: 日本橋江戸ばし → 日本橋より江戸橋を望む
sen.e: Nihonbashi Edobashi, looking at Edo-bashi bridge from Nihon-bashi bridge
Nihonbashi Edobashi: Looking at Edo-bashi Bridge from Nihon-bashi Bridge
Nihonbashi Edobashi: Looking at Edo-bashi Bridge from Nihon-bashi Bridge

sen.j: 永代橋佃しま → 永代橋より佃島を望む
sen.e: Eidaibashi Tsukudashima, looking at Tsukudashima from Eidai-bashi bridge
Eidaibashi Tsukudashima: Looking at Tsukudashima from Eidai-bashi Bridge
Eidaibashi Tsukudashima: Looking at Tsukudashima from Eidai-bashi Bridge

sen.j: 外桜田弁慶堀糀町 → 外桜田より弁慶堀（桜田濠）・麹町方面を望む
sen.e: Sotosakurada Benkeibori Kojimachi, looking at Benkeibori and Kojimachi-city from Sotosakurada
Sotosakurada Benkeibori Kojimachi: Looking at Benkeibori (also known as Sakuradago) and Kojimachi from Sotosakurada
Sotosakurada Benkeibori Kojimachi: Looking at Benkeibori (also known as Sakuradago) and Kojimachi from Sotosakurada

sen.j: 鉄砲洲稲荷橋湊神社 → 鉄砲洲より稲荷橋と湊神社を望む
sen.e: Teppozu Inaribashi Minatojinja, looking at Inari-bashi bridge and Minato-jinja shrine from Teppozu
Teppozu Inaribashi Minatojinja: Looking at Inari-bashi Bridge and Minato-jinja Shrine from Teppozu
Teppozu Inaribashi Minatojinja: Looking at Inari-bashi Bridge and Minato-jinja Shrine from Teppozu

sen.j: 高田姿見のはし俤の橋砂利場 → 高田の姿見の橋・俤の橋から砂利場方面を望む
sen.e: Takadanosugataminohashi Teinobashi Jariba, looking at Jariba from Takadanosugatamino-bashi bridge and Teino-bashi bridge
Takadanosugataminohashi Omokagenohashi Jariba: Looking at Jariba (gravel pit) from Sugatami-bashi Bridge and Omokage-bashi Bridge at Takada.
